abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the China Anning Valley
            Agricultural Development Project were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            negligible to low, the Bank performance was satisfactory,
            and the Borrower performance was satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) an integrated river valley development
            approach proved to be practical and effective in addressing
            multiple development objectives for poverty reduction; 2)
            strong Borrower ownership and effective project management
            are essential for successful implementation; 3) the
            innovation and adoption of new approaches need careful
            preparation and testing; and 4) parallel financing with
            national programs is desirable to up-scale Bank project operations.
